recipe.name: Macaroni and Cheese
recipe.description: Amazing mac and cheese recipe with a 5:1 cheese-to-pasta ratio — the ultimate tour of Italian greatness in America. A rich, creamy blend of gouda, cream, ricotta, monterey jack, and fontina cheeses, finished with parsley for garnish.

context.author_comment: Sure, the boxed mac gets the job done, but homemade from scratch is unbeatable. With ingredients from just two main food groups — dairy and starch — there’s no reason not to try.
context.serving_context: Perfect for a cozy night watching movies at home or for sharing at a potluck. Always a crowd-pleaser.
context.flavor_notes: Creamy, cheesy, and slightly smoky if using smoked gouda.

tools: Large pot (enough to fit all ingredients)

steps.title: Ingredients
instructions: Gather and measure all ingredients as listed.
Prepare tools including pot, baking dish, and colander.

steps.title: Preparation
instructions: Separate and grate 4 oz of Fontina and 4 oz of Gouda for topping.
Slice or crumble hard cheeses to help them melt faster.
Perform these tasks while water begins to heat for boiling.

steps.title: Boil the Mac
instructions: Cook macaroni noodles one minute less than the time indicated on the box.
Drain noodles in a colander and return them to the pot.
Note: Noodles will continue to cook in the oven.

steps.title: Adding Ingredients
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Add butter and evaporated milk to noodles; stir until butter melts.
Add all cream, ricotta, and Monterey Jack cheese.
Add 8 oz of Gouda and 8 oz of Fontina; stir until mostly melted.
Season with salt, pepper, and parsley to taste.
Mix thoroughly to ensure even coating.

steps.title: Swapping Containers
instructions: Transfer noodle mixture from pot to 9x13 baking dish.
Sprinkle 4 oz grated Gouda and 4 oz grated Fontina evenly on top.
Place baking dish in preheated oven.
Bake for 30 minutes, then check the top.
If not golden brown, bake for another 5 minutes and recheck every 5 minutes.
Remove from oven once golden brown (should not exceed 45 minutes total).
Let cool slightly before serving.

steps.title: Enjoy
instructions: Dish out servings and enjoy your mac and cheese.
Optionally garnish with extra parsley before serving.

notes: Smoked Gouda gives a rich, smoky depth, but regular Gouda can be used for a milder flavor.
This dish pairs well with salad or roasted vegetables.
Everyone who has tried it has enjoyed it immensely.
